div.p: 3455 Table Mesa Blvd. Apt i203 • Boulder, CO 80305

ul.li: I work on the Element software that controls our storage system.
I was responsible for refactoring, and then maintaining, the drive management sub-system, which is responsible for keeping track of drives and starting and stopping the services associated with them.
I also work on smaller features and enhancements, including improvements to fault detection, API improvements, and hardware monitoring.
I was previously on the White Box Testing Team, and we added the Recorder sub-system that's responsible for the structured logging inside the Element software.
Use code coverage, static analysis, and similar tools to improve code and reduce bugs.
Respond to support escalations
Worked on the Interop translation portion of the new CATIA Geometric Modeller (CGM) based product. Used C++, Python and Scheme for test generation
Used Python to streamline development.
Used Agile development in the Productivity and Tools group to develop the internal "TestCenter" web application. Used Java, JSP, JUnit, MySQL and Tomcat.
Maintained the "Quality Checker" (QC) component of TestCenter in C++.
Participated in a "team room" with Interop developers to develop the beta release of the CGM Writer component.
Participated in a "team room" with ACIS developers to develop of new CGM componenent.
Refactored code in TestCenter, QC, Interop, and CGM to improve readability and efficiency.
Initially worked in the "DBA Group", developing a web interface for creating, verifying, and managing Unique Identifier (UID) labels
Took over development of the internal DBA website
Created a C++ application for hand-held bar code scanners to communicate with existing inventory management system.
Volunteered for, and eventually moved to, a "Systems" development position, writing Jovial and x86 assembly language for the Automated Remote Tracking Station Software (ARTS)
Assisted with maintenance and deployment of ARTS at customer sites
This position required a Secret level security clearance
Maintained 1.5 million lines of C++ code using DCE RPC, Oracle 10g, and Solaris for the server portion of the CarlX library management system.
Used Ruby to automate testing and bug reproduction.
Refactored code to improve readability and efficiency.
Developed call routing applications for Verizon's Next Generation Service Network (NGSN).
Performed QA on applications built by other developers.
Performed troubleshooting and corrected trouble tickets.
Developed coaching tool and member's website using Java, J2EE, JSP, Hibernate, Struts, and MySQL
Created Perl and Visual Basic 6 utilities.

div.div: University of Colorado At Colorado Springs

div.p: Received Bachelor of Science in Computer Science with minor in Economics
In my free time I've released a number of small projects as open source, most of which are available at https://github.com/jl2.
